heisig_chinese_memo: Looks like a hammer shaping something metal on a stone.
heisig_story: With a mouth under a cliff, what else could we have here but the entrance to a secret cavern, before which a great stone has been rolled so that none may enter. Perhaps it is the hiding place where Ali Baba and his band of thieves have stored their treasures, in which case that magic word known to every school child who ever delighted over the tales of the Arabian Nights should be enough to push the stone aside. But take care - the cliff is steep, and one slip will send you tumbling down into the ravine below. This is the one and only time that the second stroke in cliff will reach over to the middle of the horizontal stroke. If you think of the edge jutting outwards (in keeping with the story above), the problem should be taken care of.
koohiiStory1: Indiana Jones jumps up and grabs the lip of cliff just in time to evade the huge STONE rolling out of the mouth of the cave!
koohiiStory2: ThereÂ´s a VERY simple way to remember this, in case the cliff thing isnÂ´t working for you... Just see it as a stone [ã„ã—] being hammered by a miner searching for jewel stones [ã»ã†ã›ã] ;).

origin_of_ch_char_book: In ancient China, people enjoyed music created on various instruments. (è², å£°, sheng, sound) is a character combination which shows a musical instrument (çŸ³, shi, stone) that is made by a flat stone, an ear (è€³, er, ear), a mouth which is singing , a bow to play the instrument, and a hand which is holding the bow. All together, it shows someone playing a stone instrument similar to the one shown below. Later the meaning of the word evolved to mean â€œsoundâ€.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle " factory " is like a stone chime, and its original meaning is stone. Because the stone shape is difficult to express, and the chime is a typical musical instrument made of stone, it is represented by the chime shape. After adding " mouth " next to the pen, it is meaningless. See " Ching ". The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning, as in "Collection" 7695: "Zhen, Wu has stone". Used as a place name, and borrowed as " Er ", a kind of sacrifice name.

Jin Wencheng Oracle, from the factory to the mouth. Bronze used as a unit of weight, weighing a hundred and twenty pounds, [concubine son] ğ§Š’ pot: "Otsuka (weight) a stone mound three hundred Sajiu knife (weight)." "Pass for" stone shrine ", represents the ancestral temple in Tibet The stone room of the god is like the father Xinwei: "Shi (Er) Zong". Also used as a name, etc.

"Shuowen": "Stones, mountains and rocks. Under the factory; mouth, pictogram. All stone belongs to the stone." "Shuowen" Xiaozhuan from â—‹, not from the mouth. It is shaped like a stone, which is incompatible with ancient characters. "Kangxi Dictionary" Xiaozhuan changed from the mouth, the same as the ancient characters. Duan Yucai's Note: "Or borrowed as a huge character, or borrowed as a zhezi".

In the Qin and Han characters of the Warring States Period, " stone " is homophonic as " shuo ", "Han Shu. "Law Lizhi": "Stones, Da Ye." "Mawangdui. "Yi": "Stone fruits do not eat", the handed down "Yi" is made "fruitful".

" Stone " was used as a unit of weight. Later, "Shuowen" was used as " Ze ", which said: "Ze, one hundred and twenty catties." Gui Fu's "Yizheng" said: "Ze, this province is used as stone and pronounced as burden. "The Songs of Chu. Chapter Nine. "Sorrowful Return to the Wind": "What is the benefit of the heavy task of stone" Wang Yi's note: "Stone, one is used as a scorpion." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "As a squat, the sound of a stone is a hundred and twenty catties."

Heisig: With a mouth under a cliff, what else could we have here but the entrance to a secret cavern, before which a great stone has been rolled so that none may enter. Perhaps it is the hiding place where Ali Baba and his band of thieves have stored their treasures, in which case that magic word known to every school child who ever delighted over the tales of the Arabian Nights should be enough to push the stone aside. But take care - the cliff is steep, and one slip will send you tumbling down into the ravine below. This is the one and only time that the second stroke in cliff will reach over to the middle of the horizontal stroke. If you think of the edge jutting outwards (in keeping with the story above), the problem should be taken care of.
* The stone is a quite common primitive element, which is not restricted to great boulders but used of stones or rocks of any size or shape.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»shÃ­ï¼½ï¼»dÃ nï¼½
["Guangyun" often only cuts into the past, Zen. ]
(1) Rock; stone. The mineral lumps that make up the earth's crust.
(2) Refers to meteorites.
(3) Refers to the whetstone. The extension is flattening.
(4) The name of the instrument. Refers to the stone chime. One of the ancient octave.
(5) Refers to the stele.
(6) Refers to mineral drugs.
(7) Refers to the so-called longevity medicine made from ore in Taoism.
(8) Refers to Bianstone. Stone needles used in ancient times to treat diseases.
(9) The extension is acupuncture Bianstone, which uses stone needles to cure diseases.
(10) The provincial name of the stone.
(11) Sturdy; hard.
(12) Describes that the sound is heavy and not loud.
(13) Throw.
(14) Through "Master". Big. See "Stone Master", "Stone Painting", etc.
(15) Ancient place names.
(16) The name of the ancient Western Regions.
(17) Quantifiers. (Read dÃ n today). Unit for calculating capacity. Ten buckets are one stone.
(18) Quantifiers. (Read dÃ n today). The unit for calculating weight. One hundred and twenty catties are one stone.
(19) Quantifiers. (Read dÃ n today). The unit of measurement of official salaries. Qin and Han thought the ranks of official ranks, such as ten thousand stones, two thousand stones and so on.
(20) Quantifiers. (Read dÃ n today). A unit for calculating the strength of a crossbow.
(21) Quantifiers. (Read dÃ n today). dialect. The unit for calculating the acres of farmland.
(22) Last name.
